"Windball": In this sport, players wear inflatable suits with a large ball attached to their back. The objective is to score points by throwing the ball into the opposing team's goal while wearing the suit. The catch is that the suit must be kept inflated at all times, and any deflection or bounce of the ball results in a penalty.

"Skyball": In this sport, players wear helmets with a small ball attached to the front. The objective is to score points by throwing the ball into the opposing team's goal while flying in the air. The catch is that players can only use their arms and legs to fly and must avoid collisions with other players and obstacles.

"Sandball": In this sport, players wear helmets with a small ball attached to the front. The objective is to score points by throwing the ball into the opposing team's goal while sliding on the ground. The catch is that players can only use their arms and legs to slide and must avoid collisions with other players and obstacles.

"Bubbleball": In this sport, players wear inflatable bubbles with a small ball attached to the front. The objective is to score points by throwing the ball into the opposing team's goal while bouncing off the walls of the arena. The catch is that any deflection or bounce of the ball results in a penalty.

"Rainbowball": In this sport, players wear helmets with a small ball attached to the front. The objective is to score points by throwing the ball into the opposing team's goal while jumping on a trampoline. The catch is that players can only use their arms and legs to jump and must avoid collisions with other players and obstacles.
